block.p: An early warm-weather surprise: the appearance of silver handbags and shoes as an alternative to summer white. There are even three sculptured stainless steel trees by the artist Roxy Paine in Madison Square Park, at Fifth Avenue and 23rd Street. The shimmering silver bags mark a departure from the heavy hardware decorations on purses last winter, instead relying on quilting for a textured surface. This is echoed in the huge silver rock that looks like a fallen meteorite in the park.
